column4: copy and paste the following, sudo sed '/s/# deb/deb/g' -i.old /etc/apt/sources.list && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install mozilla-dev mozilla-psm
just copy and paste that entire thing,
that's not valid regex ...
sed: -e expression #1, char 4: comments don't accept any addresses
did you try my command and this is an error you say?
if you could pastebin  your sources.list that would probably be best. Did you copy and paste that entire command like I said or try some other way?
just copy and pasted it ...
the whole thing including the &&'s
http://pastebin.ca/246433
are you on breezy or dapper?
dapper
darn, the update never updated the sources.list ....
run the following command then, sudo sed 's/breezy/dapper/g' -i.backup /etc/apt/sources.list && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install mozilla-dev mozilla-psm
Ok, I swapped breezy with dapper myself in the sources.list ...
yeah the command will still be fine even if you already replaced
democracy is terrible, I will agree with you there
it's a waste of time,

what do you mean internet tv. If you want to view flash videos or other imbedded stuff, you can do that in firefox. If you want to torrent stuff, you can do that and view it with totem or another media player. There is no need for that super app
well I have a need for a proper TV channel surfer, kinda like that one ... <babo can't remember the name of the windows one>
maybe it is one of those things you need once you have used it. I have never used any of those for any amount of time.
